diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Time pruning to avoid new growth during peak leafminer populations, encourage parasitic wasps, spinosad applications
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Spinosad sprays on new growth, horticultural oil. Mainly aesthetic on mature trees.

diseasesAndPests.name: Aphids (Various species)
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Curled leaves, sticky honeydew, sooty mold, transmit tristeza virus
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Monitor new growth, encourage beneficial insects (ladybugs, lacewings), avoid excessive nitrogen
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Strong water spray, insecticidal soap, horticultural oil, neem oil

diseasesAndPests.name: Scale Insects (Armored and Soft scales)
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Bumps on leaves/stems/fruit, yellowing, honeydew, sooty mold, reduced vigor
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Monitor regularly, encourage natural predators, maintain tree vigor
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Horticultural oil sprays (dormant and growing season), systemic insecticides for severe infestations

lightRequirements.notes: Full sun required for optimal flowering, fruit set, and sugar development. Shade reduces yield and fruit quality.

gradingStandards.sizeRequirements: Uniform size 6.5-8.5cm diameter, 150-250g per fruit, symmetrical shape
gradingStandards.colorRequirements: Deep orange color, no greening, uniform coloring
gradingStandards.defectTolerance: No blemishes, no scars, no insect damage, firm texture, high juice content (>50%), >10° Brix

gradingStandards.colorRequirements: Good orange color, minor green tinge acceptable
gradingStandards.defectTolerance: Minor surface blemishes acceptable, slight scarring allowed, >9° Brix
Surface defects acceptable, suitable for juice extraction, >8° Brix

economicsAndLabor.notes: Long-term investment (3-4 years to first harvest). Moderate labor for pruning, disease/pest management. Consistent annual production. Fresh market and juice processing options.

additionalInfo.notes: Subtropical evergreen tree reaching 6-12m height. Grafted trees recommended - bear earlier and resist root diseases. Rootstock selection critical for disease resistance and soil adaptation. Popular rootstocks: Carrizo citrange, Swingle citrumelo (disease resistant). Varieties for UAE: Valencia (juice, late season), Navel (fresh eating, early season), Hamlin (juice, early). Fruit can hang on tree for months after maturity. Harvest when fruit reaches proper sugar/acid ratio. In UAE, main flowering March-April, harvest Nov-May depending on variety. One main crop, possible secondary bloom. Prune to maintain open canopy, remove dead/crossing branches. CRITICAL: Citrus greening disease is devastating - use certified disease-free trees, control psyllid vectors.

yieldInfo.notes: Continuous harvest over 4-6 weeks per fruiting period. Day-neutral varieties can produce year-round. June-bearing types produce one large crop. Everbearing types produce 2-3 crops per year.

fertilizerSchedule.notes: Apply at planting to encourage root development. High phosphorus for root establishment.
Apply every 3 weeks during vegetative growth. Promotes runner and crown development.
Apply during flowering and fruiting. High K improves fruit quality, flavor, and firmness. Continue through harvest.

pesticideSchedule.safetyNotes: Spray undersides of leaves thoroughly. Apply in early morning or evening. Organic control options.
Preventative fungicide. Apply before disease appears. Good air circulation critical. Remove infected fruit immediately.

temperature.notes: Cool to moderate season crop. Flowering and fruit set best at 18-24°C. High temps (>30°C) reduce fruit size and quality, increase disease. In UAE, best grown Oct-Apr. Greenhouse with cooling recommended for summer production.

humidity.notes: Moderate to high humidity during growth. However, lower humidity (<70%) during flowering reduces gray mold risk. Good air circulation essential.

environmentalRequirements.airCirculation: Excellent air circulation critical to reduce fungal diseases (gray mold, powdery mildew). Essential in greenhouse production.

wateringRequirements.frequency: Frequent light watering to maintain consistent soil moisture
wateringRequirements.type: Drip irrigation strongly preferred to keep foliage dry
wateringRequirements.amount: 20-30mm per week, adjust for plant size and fruiting stage
wateringRequirements.notes: Shallow root system requires consistent moisture. Overhead watering increases disease - use drip. Water stress during fruiting reduces berry size. Avoid waterlogging.

soilRequirements.nutrientsRecommendations: Moderate nitrogen - excess causes soft fruit and disease. High potassium for fruit quality. Adequate calcium prevents tip burn. Boron improves pollen viability and fruit set.
soilRequirements.notes: Requires well-drained soil rich in organic matter. Raised beds highly recommended for drainage. Excellent for soilless growing (hydroponics, substrate culture). Intolerant of waterlogged conditions.

diseasesAndPests.name: Two-spotted Spider Mites
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Fine webbing on undersides of leaves, stippled yellow leaves, bronzing, reduced vigor, leaf death
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Monitor undersides of leaves weekly, maintain adequate moisture, encourage predatory mites, avoid dusty conditions
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Horticultural oil, insecticidal soap, neem oil, predatory mites (biological control). Rotate spray materials.

diseasesAndPests.name: Gray Mold / Botrytis (Botrytis cinerea)
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Gray fuzzy mold on flowers and fruit, fruit rot, brown lesions on leaves and stems
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Adequate spacing, drip irrigation (avoid wetting foliage), good air circulation, remove infected fruit immediately, avoid overhead watering
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Bacillus subtilis, potassium bicarbonate, copper fungicides. Remove all infected plant parts. Improve air flow.

diseasesAndPests.name: Aphids
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: Clusters on young leaves and flowers, sticky honeydew, distorted growth, virus transmission
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Monitor new growth, reflective mulches, encourage beneficial insects, remove weeds
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Strong water spray, insecticidal soap, neem oil, horticultural oil. Yellow sticky traps.

diseasesAndPests.name: Powdery Mildew
diseasesAndPests.symptoms: White powdery coating on leaves (especially undersides), leaf curling, reduced photosynthesis
diseasesAndPests.preventionMeasures: Adequate spacing, avoid overhead watering, resistant varieties, sulfur applications
diseasesAndPests.treatmentOptions: Sulfur fungicides (avoid during hot weather), potassium bicarbonate, biological fungicides

lightRequirements.notes: Day-length affects flowering. Short-day varieties flower with <12 hours light. Day-neutral varieties flower regardless of day-length (best for UAE). Long-day varieties need >14 hours. Full sun produces best flavor and yield. Partial shade acceptable in hot climates.

gradingStandards.sizeRequirements: Large uniform berries 3-4cm diameter, symmetrical conic shape
gradingStandards.colorRequirements: Bright red, 90%+ color coverage, glossy appearance, green cap fresh
gradingStandards.defectTolerance: No defects, firm texture, no white shoulders, no bruising, excellent flavor, >8° Brix

gradingStandards.colorRequirements: Red, 75%+ color coverage, minor white shoulders acceptable
gradingStandards.defectTolerance: Minor surface blemishes acceptable, firm, good flavor, >7° Brix
Surface defects acceptable if flesh sound, suitable for jam, freezing, processing

economicsAndLabor.notes: High value crop commanding premium prices. Labor-intensive for harvesting (pick every 2-3 days during peak). Greenhouse production allows year-round harvest. Day-neutral varieties most profitable for UAE climate.

spacing.notes: Matted row system: 45cm x 90cm. Hill system (raised beds): 30cm x 30cm for higher density. Double row on raised beds common.

additionalInfo.notes: Herbaceous perennial grown as annual or renewed every 2-3 years. Three types by flowering: June-bearing (one large spring crop), Everbearing (2-3 smaller crops per year), Day-neutral (continuous production, best for UAE). Raised beds strongly recommended for drainage and disease management. Plastic mulch common to reduce disease, conserve moisture, keep fruit clean. Drip irrigation under mulch ideal. Remove runners on fruiting plants to concentrate energy on fruit production. In UAE, plant Oct-Nov for winter/spring production. Greenhouse with cooling extends season. Highly suitable for vertical hydroponic systems and substrate culture. Popular varieties for UAE: Albion, San Andreas (day-neutral), Festival, Florida Radiance. Strawberries do not ripen after picking - harvest when fully colored. Very perishable - handle gently, cool immediately after harvest.
